variable.description: free text containing TCL configuration information
variable.name: tclConfigData

variable.description: YYYY-MM-DD-HH:MM:SS.xxx, xxx are the milliseconds\nbased on GMT
variable.name: timeStamp

variable.description: free text containing the constituent configuration\nidentification (e.g. release note reference)
variable.name: adaptorConfigData

variable.description: YYYY-MM-DD-HH:MM:SS.xxx, xxx are the milliseconds\nbased on GMT
variable.name: timeStamp

variable.description: true = switch on\nfalse = switch off
variable.name: activate

variable.description: true = switched on\nfalse = switched off
variable.name: activated

variable.description: Meter - distance to be moved\nPositive values means moving in direction of Cab\nA, negative values in direction of Cab B
variable.name: coldMovement

variable.description: true = see table above\nfalse = see table above
variable.name: obuReset

variable.description: true = switch on\nfalse = switch off
variable.name: activate

variable.description: true = switched on\nfalse = switched off
variable.name: activated

variable.description: true = activate logging\nfalse = deactivate logging
variable.name: activate

variable.description: name of the logfile; max length: 25 characters\n(only numbers and letters allowed)
variable.name: logname

variable.description: true = activate transfer to TCL\nfalse = no transfer
variable.name: transfer

variable.description: name of the logfile
variable.name: logname

variable.description: true = delete logfile\nfalse = no action
variable.name: delete

variable.description: name of the logfile
variable.name: logname

variable.description:
sequence number:
The complete logfile should be split into a
sequence starting with '1' of
'LOGGING.result' due to network resources
variable.name: sequenceNumber

variable.description: false = the sequence will be continued\ntrue = last message of the sequence
variable.name: complete

variable.description: true = activate transfer to TCL\nfalse = no transfer
variable.name: transfer

variable.description: name of the logfile
variable.name: logname

variable.description:
true = UNISIG decoded ASCII translation of
JRU-data
false = binary format of JRU-data according to
SUBSET-027
variable.name: translation

variable.description: name of the logfile
variable.name: logname

variable.description: ASCII or binary
variable.name: data

variable.description:
sequence number:
The complete logfile should be split into a
sequence of 'JRU-LOGGING.result' due to
network resources, starting with '1'.
variable.name: sequenceNumber

variable.description: false = the sequence will be continued\ntrue = last message of the sequence
variable.name: complete

variable.description: 0 = information (general purpose message)\n1 = warning\n2 = error
variable.name: severity

variable.description: number of occurrences of this error; may always\nreported as 0
variable.name: counter

variable.description: full text or mnemonic
variable.name: message

variable.description: if applicable; for instance:\n'OBU.activate
variable.name: causingMethod

variable.description:
0 = speed intervention mode 'SIM'
1 = position intervention mode 'PIM'
2 = automatic mode 'AM'
3 = automatic mode with release speed
variable.name: mode

variable.description: see note below
variable.name: trainDirection

variable.description: range: 0 - 150 % of permitted speed\n(used only in automatic mode to adjust\nthe speed)
variable.name: percentage

variable.description: 1-100%, How many percent of max acc\nshall be used.
variable.name: percentageThrottle

variable.description: 1-100%. How many percent of max brake\ncapacity shall be used. Can be used in\nmode 0 and 1.
variable.name: percentageBrake

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the
service brakes command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to service brake parameters.
variable.name: disableSB

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the
emergency brakes command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to emergency brake parameters.
variable.name: disableEB

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the
traction cut-off command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to traction cut-off parameters.
variable.name: disableTCO

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the
Electro Pneumatic Brake command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to Electro Pneumatic Brake parameters
variable.name: disableElectroPneumaticBrake

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the Eddy
Current Brake command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to Eddy Current Brake parameters.
variable.name: disableEddyCurrentBrake

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the
Regenerative Brake command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to Regenerative Brake parameters.
variable.name: disableRegenerativeBrake

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the
Magnetic Shoe Brake command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to Magnetic Shoe Brake parameters
variable.name: disableMagneticShoeBrake

variable.description:
true = the OBU Adaptor follows the speed
target without taking into account the
Additional Brake command;
false = the OBU Adaptor brakes according
to Additional Brake parameters.
variable.name: disableAdditionalBrake

variable.description: +254promill to - 254promill\n+ = uphill\n- = downhill
variable.name: gradient

variable.description: unique identifier of a balise, used\nbetween TCL and OBU Adaptor (range:\npositive values)
variable.name: elementHandle

variable.description: Coded balise telegram data as it has to\nbe sent from the balise to the EVC\nantenna
variable.name: codedBaliseTelegram

variable.description: unique identifier of a balise, used between TCL\nand OBU Adaptor (range: positive values)
variable.name: elementHandle

variable.description: 1 = cab A\n2 = cab B
variable.name: activeAntenna

variable.description: distance between train-head (always cabin-A) and\nactive antenna in metres
variable.name: antennaOffset

variable.description: unique identifier of a loop, used between\nTCL and OBU Adaptor (range: positive\nvalues)
variable.name: elementHandle

variable.description: coded EUROLOOP telegram data as it has\nto be sent from the loop to the EVC\nantenna
variable.name: codedLoopTelegram

variable.description: unique identifier of a loop, used between TCL and\nOBU Adaptor (range: positive values)
variable.name: elementHandle

variable.description:
unique identifier of a NTC track element,
used between TCL and OBU
Adaptor/external injector (range: positive
values)
variable.name: elementHandle

variable.description:
element type
e.g.: KER, ZUB123, etc.
The content of this attribute must be
agreed between TCL and OBU Adaptor
suppliers
variable.name: elementType

variable.description: coded NTC element data
variable.name: elementData

variable.description: length in bits of the element data\n-1 = Not used
variable.name: elementDataLength

variable.description: unique identifier of a NTC track element, used\nbetween TCL and OBU Adaptor/external injector\n(range: positive values)
variable.name: elementHandle

variable.description: true = enter SL\nfalse = release SL
variable.name: activate

variable.description: true = PS is permitted\nfalse = PS is not permitted
variable.name: permitted

variable.description: true = NL is permitted\nfalse = NL is not permitted
variable.name: permitted

variable.description: 0 .. 600 in 1km/h steps (used since SRS 3.6.0)\n-1 : not available
variable.name: setSpeedValue

variable.description: 0 = brake command deactivated\n1 = brake command activated\n-1 = unknown
variable.name: emergencyBrake

variable.description: 0 = brake command deactivated\n1 = brake command activated\n-1 = unknown
variable.name: serviceBrake

variable.description: 0 = deactivated\n1 = activated\n-1 = unknown
variable.name: tractionCutOff

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall not be inhibited
1 = shall be inhibited
-1 = unknown
variable.name: regenerativeBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall not be inhibited
1 = shall be inhibited
-1 = unknown
variable.name: magneticShoeBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall not be inhibited
1 = shall be inhibited
-1 = unknown
variable.name: eddyCurrentBrakeForSB

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall not be inhibited
1 = shall be inhibited
-1 = unknown
variable.name: eddyCurrentBrakeForEB

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall be deactivated
1 = shall be activated
-1 = no change
variable.name: regenerativeBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall be deactivated
1 = shall be activated
-1 = no change
['eddyCurrentBrake'] int optional
variable.name: magneticShoeBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall be deactivated
1 = shall be activated
-1 = no change
variable.name: eddyCurrentBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall be deactivated
1 = shall be activated
-1 = no change
variable.name: electroPneumaticBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = shall be deactivated
1 = shall be activated
-1 = no change
variable.name: additionalBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = no interface
1 = interface exists and affects only EB
2 = interface exists and affects only SB
3 = interface exists and affects EB and SB
variable.name: regenerativeBrake

variable.description: optional\n0 = no interface\n1 = interface exists and affects only EB
variable.name: magneticShoeBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = no interface
1 = interface exists and affects only EB
2 = interface exists and affects only SB
3 = interface exists and affects EB and SB
variable.name: eddyCurrentBrake

variable.description:
optional
0 = no interface
1 = interface exists and affects only SB
2 = interface exists and affects EB and SB
variable.name: electroPneumaticBrake

variable.description: optional\n0 = not implemented\n1 = implemented
variable.name: additionalBrake

variable.description: optional\n0 = not implemented\n1 = implemented
variable.name: serviceBrakeInterface

variable.description: optional\n0 = not implemented\n1 = implemented
variable.name: tractionCutOffInterface

variable.description: 0 .. 100\nfrom 0 to 10 bar in steps of 0.1 bar
variable.name: pressure

variable.description: 1 = train integrity OK\n0 = train integrity NOK\n-1 = train integrity not available
variable.name: activate

variable.description: 0 = none\n1 = cab A\n2 = cab B
variable.name: activeCab

variable.description: 1 = FORWARD\n2 = REVERSE\n3 = NEUTRAL
variable.name: drivingDirection

variable.description: 0 = Lower pantograph\n1 = Raise pantograph
variable.name: pantograph

variable.description: 0 = Air tightness not active\n1 = Air tightness active
variable.name: airTightness

variable.description: 0 = Main power switch open\n1 = Main power switch close
variable.name: mainPowerSwitch

variable.description: 0 = On-board equipment not isolated\n1 = On-board equipment isolated
variable.name: isolation

variable.description: 0 = Train has not moved\n1 = Train has moved
variable.name: coldMovement

variable.description: unique identifier which defines the\ncontent of the data
variable.name: messageType

variable.description: 0 = Fixed\n1 = Flexible\n2 = Switchable
variable.name: type

variable.description: the displayed system version from the 'System\nversion window' from inside the 'Settings window'
variable.name: version

variable.description: identifier of the current active language (see next\nattribute 'languageId')
variable.name: active

variable.description: unique identifier of an available language (list)
variable.name: languageId

variable.description: (english) name of the language (description) (list)
variable.name: languageName

variable.description: identifier of the language to be activated (see\nattribute 'languageId' of DMI.replyLanguage)
variable.name: languageId

variable.description:
0 = Level 0
1 = Level NTC
2 = Level 1
3 = Level 2
4 = Level 3
(list)
variable.name: levelETCS

variable.description: NID_NTC (list)
variable.name: nationalSystemId

variable.description: name of the NTC (description) (list)
variable.name: ntcName

variable.description: an identifier used between TCL and OBU Adaptor\n(list)
variable.name: typeId

variable.description: name of the train type (description) (list)
variable.name: typeName

variable.description: an identifier used between TCL and OBU Adaptor\n(list)
variable.name: categoryId

variable.description: name of the train category (description) (list)
variable.name: categoryName

variable.description: name of the radio network (description) (list)
variable.name: networkName

variable.description: VBC code (numeric) (list)
variable.name: code

variable.description: VBC code (numeric)
variable.name: code

variable.description: VBC code (numeric)
variable.name: code

variable.description: milliseconds (default value = 200 should be given\nat least)
variable.name: periodicity

variable.description: true = reports status of cab A\nfalse = reports status of cab B
variable.name: fromToCabA

variable.description:
0 = none
1 = cab A
2 = cab B
3 = both
4 = unknown
variable.name: activeCab

variable.description: km/h - currently shown speed on the DMI.
variable.name: displayedSpeed

variable.description: km/h - currently shown permitted speed on\nthe DMI.
variable.name: permittedSpeed

variable.description: meter - distance to the next supervised target\n(active target that will cause OBU to brake)
variable.name: distanceToTarget

variable.description:
- 1 = Geo pos not available (no packet 79
received yet)
Position int = geo pos value. (min 24 bit)
unit: meter
variable.name: geoPos

variable.description:
1 = the tunnel area position will not be
displayed
Position int = distance to the track condition
in meter
variable.name: tunnelPos

variable.description: true = reports status of cab A\nfalse = reports status of cab B
variable.name: fromToCabA

variable.description:
0 = none
1 = cab A
2 = cab B
3 = both
4 = unknown
variable.name: activeCab

variable.description:
0 = Level 0
1 = Level NTC specified by 'nationalSystemId'
2 = Level 1
3 = Level 2
4 = Level 3
5 = unknown
variable.name: levelETCS

variable.description: if levelETCS == 1: NID_NTC\nelse: -1
variable.name: nationalSystemId

variable.description:
0 = Full Supervision (FS)
1 = On Sight (OS)
2 = Staff Responsible (SR)
3 = Shunting (SH)
4 = Unfitted (UN)
5 = Sleeping (SL)
6 = Stand By (SB)
7 = Trip (TR)
8 = Post Trip (PT)
9 = System Failure (SF)
10 = Isolation (IS)
11 = Non Leading (NL)
12 = Limited Supervision (LS)
13 = National System (NS)
14 = Reversing (RV)
15 = Passive Shunting (PS)
variable.name: modeETCS

variable.description: true = slippery rail activated\nfalse = normal conditions
variable.name: adhesion

variable.description: 0 = no indication\n1 = flashing indication (EM received)\n2 = Intervention (Brake due to EM)
variable.name: emergencyMsgIndication

variable.description: true = Override EOA is activated\nfalse = Override EOA is not activated
variable.name: overrideEOA

variable.description:
0 = no warning
1 = pre-indication (not used since SRS 3.6.0)
2 = indication
3 = warning
4 = intervention
5 = over-speed
variable.name: warningStatus

variable.description:
corresponds to the 7 bits of M_VERSION:
e.g.
16 = Version 1.0 ( 001 0000 )
17 = Version 1.1 ( 001 0001 )
32 = Version 2.0 ( 010 0000 )
33 = Version 2.1 ( 010 0001 )
variable.name: etcsVersionInfo

variable.description: true: reversing is permitted\nfalse: reversing is not permitted
variable.name: reversingPermitted

variable.description:
The Lowest Supervised Speed within the Movement
Authority (LSSMA) shall be displayed
-1 : LSSMA is not displayed
Other : the LSSMA value shall be displayed
variable.name: lssma

variable.description: 0 .. 600 in 1km/h steps (used since SRS 3.6.0)\n-1 : not available
variable.name: setSpeedValue

variable.description: true = reports status of cab A\nfalse = reports status of cab B
variable.name: fromToCabA

variable.description:
0 = none
1 = cab A
2 = cab B
3 = both
4 = unknown
variable.name: activeCab

variable.description: 0 = not connected\n1 = connecting\n2 = connected
variable.name: connectionStatus1

variable.description: 0 = not connected\n1 = connecting\n2 = connected
variable.name: connectionStatus2

variable.description: must be unique over all 'active' messages,\nmay be a counter
variable.name: messageHandle

variable.description: in case of a 'Predefined Text Message', the\nEnglish version has to be used
variable.name: messageText

variable.description: true = message appears\nfalse = message disappears
variable.name: active

variable.description:
- track condition:
0 = non stopping area
1 = non stopping area tunnel
2 = sound horn
3 = powerless section (pantograph)
4 = radio hole
5 = air tightness
6 = switch off regenerative brake
7 = switch off eddy current brake
8 = switch off magnetic shoe brake
9 = powerless section (main power)
10 = switch off eddy current brake for
emergency brake
- route suitability data:
16 = loading gauge profile
17 = max axle load
18 = traction system
- big metal masses
32 = balise transmission control
- change of traction system
64 = traction power control
- change of allowed current consumption
128 = allowed current consumption
- station platform
256 = platform info
- level crossing info
512 = level crossing
variable.name: type

variable.description: 0 - 327670,0 meter (10cm steps)
variable.name: distanceToEntrancePoint

variable.description:
0 - 327670,0 meter (10cm steps)
used for types:
- track condition (0 - 9)
- big metal masses (32)
- platform info (256)
- level crossing (512)
other : 0
variable.name: length

variable.description:
used for types:
- route suitability data (16 - 18)
if type = 16: M_LINEGAUGE
if type = 17: M_AXLELOADCAT
if type = 18: M_VOLTAGE
- change of traction system(64)
if type = 64: M_VOLTAGE
- change of allowed current consumption
(128)
if type = 128: M_CURRENT
- platform info (256)
if type = 256: M_PLATFORM
- level crossing (512)
if type = 512: NID_LX
other: 0
variable.name: value

variable.description:
used for types:
- change of traction power (64)
if type = 64: NID_CTRACTION
- route suitability data (18)
if type = 18: NID_CTRACTION
- platform info (256)
if type = 256: Q_PLATFORM
- level crossing (512)
if type = 512: Q_LXSTATUS
other: 0
variable.name: value2

variable.description:
used for types:
- level crossing (512)
if type = 512: V_LX
other: 0
variable.name: value3

variable.description:
used for types:
- level crossing (512)
if type = 512: L_STOPLX
other: 0
variable.name: value4

variable.description:
This array contains an array (array2) of all
possible NTC data labels together with all
possible selectable items. This array2 is
given for all possible NTC data labels and
has the following structure:
string:data label name,
possible selectable item1,
possible selectable item 2,
...
If the array is empty, there is no dedicated
keyboard.
variable.name: NTCDataLabel

variable.description: 8 characters\n0 to 99999999\nFFFFFFFF reserved for unknown
variable.name: trainId

variable.description:
0 = Level 0
1 = Level NTC specified by 'nationalSystemId'
2 = Level 1
3 = Level 2
4 = Level 3
variable.name: levelETCS

variable.description: if levelETCS == 1: NID_NTC\nelse: -1
variable.name: nationalSystemId

variable.description: 0 = new data entry\n1 = contact last RBC\n2 = use short number
variable.name: rbcDataEntryType

variable.description: see the values given by 4.3.10.94.3.10.9
variable.name: trainType

variable.description: see the values given by 4.3.10.114.3.10.11
variable.name: trainCategory

variable.description: 0 - 4095 m in 1m steps (L_TRAIN)
variable.name: trainLength

variable.description: -1 = Not Applicable\n0 - 250% in 1% steps
variable.name: brakePercentage

variable.description: 0 - 600 km/h in 5 km/h steps
variable.name: maxTrainSpeed

variable.description:
special value:
0 = A
1 = HS17
2 = B1
3 = B2
4 = C2
5 = C3
6 = C4
7 = D2
8 = D3
9 = D4
10 = D4XL
11 = E4
12 = E5
(M_AXLELOADCAT )
variable.name: axleLoadCategory

variable.description: 0 = not fitted\n1 = fitted
variable.name: airTightSystem

variable.description:
Special value:
1 = G1
2 = GA
3 = GB
4 = GC
0 = Out of GC
(M_LOADINGGAUGE)
variable.name: loadingGauge

variable.description: 1 = 100%, non-slippery rail\n2 = 70%, slippery rail
variable.name: adhesionFactor

variable.description:
Staff Responsible mode speed
0 – 600 km/h in 5 km/h steps
values: 0,5,10, .. ,595,600
(based on V_NVSTFF)
variable.name: maxSRSpeed

variable.description:
maximum distance for running in Staff
Responsible mode
0 - 327660 meter in 10m steps
values: 0 .. 32766
special: 32767 means infinite
(D_NVSTFF)
variable.name: sRDistance

variable.description: true = NTC Data Entry is performed\nfalse = NTC Data Entry is skipped
variable.name: performTCDataEntry

variable.description:
Array of names of NTC data label which should
be entered
For each label the value to be entered is given in
the next attribute at the same array-position
variable.name: NTCDataLabel

variable.description: Value of the NTC Data to be entered on the DMI.
variable.name: NTCDataLabelValue

variable.description:
0 = Waiting for Driver Id (S1)
1 = Waiting for level entry (S2)
2 = Waiting for Driver Selection (S10)
3 = Waiting for 'Start' (S20)
4 = Waiting for 'SN Ack' (S22)
5 = Waiting for 'UN Ack' (S23)
6 = Waiting for 'SR Ack' (S24)
7 = Waiting for 'OS Ack' (S25)
8 = Waiting for 'SH Ack' (S25)
9 = Waiting for EOA Req (S14)
10 = Waiting for Train running number (S13)
11 = Waiting for EB release
12 = Waiting for SB release
13 = Waiting for text message ack
14 = Waiting for TAF ack
15 = Waiting for Train integrity
16 = Waiting for level transition ack
17 = Waiting for Roll Away Protection ack
18 = Confirm trip
19 = Confirm train integrity
20 = Waiting for 'LS Ack' (S25)
21 = Waiting for Reverse Movement Protection ack
22 = Waiting for Standstill Supervision ack
23 = Waiting for Post Trip distance exceeded ack
24 = Waiting for Train Data change from source
different from driver ack
25 = Waiting for NTC system selection
26 = Waiting for NTC Data Entry
variable.name: currentState

variable.description: must be unique over all 'active' messages, may be a\ncounter (see DMI.messageIndication); only valid for\ntext message ack
variable.name: messageHandle

variable.description:
5 = Shunting Request (Maintain shunting)
6 = Exit of Shunting Request
7 = Non-leading selection
8 = Exit of Non-leading request
9 = Override EOA request
10 = Override route suitability
11 = Start Button pressed
12 = Ack after Trip
13 = Ack of SR
14 = Ack of OS
15 = Ack of UN
16 = Ack of SH
17 = Ack of RV
18 = Ack of SN
19 = Ack of release EB
20 = Ack of release SB
21 = Ack of level transition
22 = Ack of Text Message
23 = Track Ahead Free Conf
24 = Train Integrity
25 = Continue Shunting on desk closure
26 = Request geo position information
27 = Request Change Level
28 = Ack of LS
29 = Ack for Roll Away Protection
30 = Ack for Reverse Movement Protection
31 = Ack for Standstill Supervision
32 = Ack for Post Trip distance exceeded
33 = Ack for Train Data change from source different from the driver
34 = Toggle the the display of the tunnel stopping area
35 = Zoom planning area
36 = Toggle the display of planning area (used up to SRS 3.4.0)
37 = display the train data
variable.name: action

variable.description:
requests (5 – 11, 25,27): true
requests (26): {true|false}
ack’s (12 – 22,28-33) : true
confirmations (23,24): {true|false}
34: true display on, false: display off
35: true: zoom in, false: zoom out
36: true: display on, false: display off
variable.name: status

variable.description: must be unique over all “active” messages, may be a\ncounter (see DMI.messageIndication); only valid for\ntext message ack(s)
variable.name: messageHandle
